ratings.comment: Rafi is fine but this class is too outdated (overhead projectors and chalkboards instead of power points or white/smart boards). This is an InfoSys class at a multi-million $ school taught using 20 year old tech which just doesn't sit right with me. This is VERY group project heavy so sit with people you think are smart & meet with the TA for HW

Like 422, this class is taught in an outdated way. He needs to create slides and actually modernize the class to fit the material. Dates in his literal "slides" often refer to software and things in the 90's. That is not acceptable for what we are paying for this class.   The help Eric provides during group project work is critical to success.

Changed class time several times throughout the semester and made material covered during those times mandatory. Required paper turnin and would not accept electronic handouts. Uses overhead projector and chalk for class - which is insulting to technology majors. In one word, this class is "antiquated."

Lazimy is really bad at teaching. Lectures are boring and unhelpful, but attendance is mandatory. Notes are confusing and often contradictory, photocopied from multiple sources. SQL project great for your resume, but you're often learning *in spite* of Lazimy, not because of him.
He is extremely knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend this professor

He really knows what he is talking about, is genuinely interested in seeing his students succeed, and the workload is very fair. The assignments were incredibly helpful, the project makes for a great talking point in job interviews, and learning Access/SQL is very helpful to have on any data related resume. Highly recommend class and prof!

Just a note, IS422 and OTM 442 are effectively identical courses, the only difference is the final project (Access vs SQL Server); you will generally see people with stronger tech backgrounds in IS422. Rafi is extremely knowledgeable and can provide feedback that is of outstanding quality (you have to leave school to appreciate it).

Lazimy is a fantastic professor. He seems genuinely interested in the material as well as your comprehension of it and is very clear in his explanation of Database concepts. My only issue was his use of an overhead projector
Dont take him unless you have to. Grades extremely hard!

He teaches by using examples which is good and he also writes everything out on the board so your not trying to write as fast as he can talk. We only had a midterm so everything we learned after that I didn't pay attention to.

Lots of work in the 422. Material itself is not that difficult. Have about 4 projects going on at the same time, all while still requiring weekly homework assignments. Only one exam (a midterm). For a professor in the Information Systems department, he should really stop using overhead transparencies to lecture from. This is the 21st century, man.
